article_title: Obamacare's 'Cadillac Tax' Could Help Reduce The Cost Of Health Care

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: By Fmr. Sen. WILLIAM H. FRIST, M.D. Like much of the Affordable Care Act, the Cadillac tax—Obamacare’s solution to a tax subsidy created during World War II—offers a solution to an important problem, but is fraught with unintended consequences. Ideally, the tax would prompt employers to offer more cost-effective plans, with some shift of risk to employees along with mechanisms to help employees spend healthcare dollars wisely. For many reasons, that is not likely to be the reality.
